1.question:
1 (a) Write 40 : 2000 as a ratio in its simplest form.  
  (a) …………… : …………… [2]

  (b) Two people share £350 in the ratio 1 : 6.  
   Calculate each share.  
  (b) £ ……………   £ …………… [2]

  (c) Find 20% of 450.  
  (c) ………………… [2]

question-components.a: Write 40 : 2000 as a ratio in its simplest form.
question-components.b: Two people share £350 in the ratio 1 : 6. Calculate each share.

2.question:

3.question:
3  Colin drinks 3/8 of a litre of milk each day.  
    Milk costs 89p for a 2-litre carton and 49p for a 1-litre carton.

    What is the smallest amount that Colin would have to spend to buy milk for one week?
    Show your working.

    £ …………………………………… [3]
3.question-components: What is the smallest amount that Colin would have to spend to buy milk for one week? Show your working.

4.question:
4  An unbiased spinner is shown below.

(a) Write a number to make each sentence true:

   (i)  It is evens that the spinner will land on number _______.  [1]

   (ii) There is a probability of 1/6 that the spinner will land on number _______.  [1]

   (iii) It is impossible that the spinner will land on number _______.  [1]

(b) The spinner below has the following properties:

   • There are eight equal sections, each showing one number.  
   • There are three different numbers on the spinner.  
   • The probability of the spinner landing on an even number is greater than the probability  
     of it landing on an odd number.  
   • It is more likely that the spinner will land on a 6 than either of the other numbers.

Complete the spinner to show one possible arrangement of numbers.  [3]

question-components.a.i: It is evens that the spinner will land on number _______.
question-components.a.ii: There is a probability of 1/6 that the spinner will land on number _______.
question-components.a.iii: It is impossible that the spinner will land on number _______.
question-components.b: Complete the spinner to show one possible arrangement of numbers.

  ┌─ Right angle
  │

                     │
                     │
                     └─────┐  ← 4 cm
                          Not to scale

Find the total area of the shape.

.................................. cm² [3]
5.question-components: Find the total area of the shape.

6.question:
6  Here is a Venn diagram:

     ┌─────────────┐     ┌─────────────┐
     │     Dog      │     │     Cat     │
     │      8       │     │             │
     └─────────────┘     └─────────────┘
             

30 students are asked if they have a dog or a cat:
 • 21 have a dog.
 • 16 have a cat.
 • 8 have a dog, but not a cat.

Complete the Venn diagram. [3]

9.question:
9  The pictogram shows how some passengers spent most of their time on a flight:

┌────────────────────┬───────────────────────────┐
│        Activity     │          Pictogram       │
├────────────────────┼───────────────────────────┤
│ Reading            │ ■   ■   ■                 │
│ Watching films     │ ■   ■   ■   □             │
│ Listening to music │                           │
│ Playing games      │ ■   ■   ■   □             │
│ Other              │ ■   ■                     │
└────────────────────┴───────────────────────────┘

Key: ■ represents 40 people

(a) How many passengers spent most of their time playing games?  
(b) How many more passengers spent most of their time watching films than reading?  
(c) There were 360 passengers on the plane.  
    Complete the pictogram for listening to music.

question-components.a: How many passengers spent most of their time playing games?
question-components.b: How many more passengers spent most of their time watching films than reading?
question-components.c: There were 360 passengers on the plane. Complete the pictogram for listening to music.

12.question:
12  Here are the first three patterns in a sequence.

Pattern 1   Pattern 2   Pattern 3

(a) Draw Pattern 4 in this sequence on the grid below.  
[2]

(b) Pattern 3 has 9 dotted squares and 12 black squares.  
How many dotted squares will there be in Pattern 8?  
(b) ………………………… [2]

(c) Write an expression for the number of black squares in the n th pattern.  
(c) ………………………… [2]

(d) Sally looks at the patterns.  
She says:  
“If the pattern number is odd, the total number of squares will be odd.  
 If it is even, the total number of squares will be even.”  

Explain clearly why Sally is right for all patterns in the sequence.

……………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………  
……………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………  
……………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………  
……………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………  
…………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………… [6]

question-components.a: Draw Pattern 4 in this sequence on the grid below.
question-components.b: Pattern 3 has 9 dotted squares and 12 black squares. How many dotted squares will there be in Pattern 8?
question-components.c: Write an expression for the number of black squares in the n th pattern.
question-components.d: Sally says: “If the pattern number is odd, the total number of squares will be odd. If it is even, the total number of squares will be even.” Explain clearly why Sally is right for all patterns in the sequence.

14.question:
14  The value of a car £V is given by  
    V = 20 000 × 0.9^t  
    where t is the age of the car in complete years.

(a)  Write down the value of V when t = 0.  
    (a) £ ………………………………………… [1]

(b)  What is the value of V when t = 3?  
    (b) £ ………………………………………… [2]

(c)  After how many complete years will the car’s value drop below £10 000?  
    (c) ………………………………………… [2]

question-components.a: Write down the value of V when t = 0.
question-components.b: What is the value of V when t = 3?
question-components.c: After how many complete years will the car’s value drop below £10,000?

15.question:
15. Kieran, Jermaine and Chris play football.

• Kieran has scored 8 more goals than Chris.  
• Jermaine has scored 5 more goals than Kieran.  
• Altogether they have scored 72 goals.

How many goals did they each score?  
You must show your working.

Kieran ……………………………  
Jermaine ……………………………  
Chris ……………………………  

[5]
15.question-components: How many goals did they each score? You must show your working. Kieran … Jermaine … Chris …

16.question:
16  Otis keeps bees in two beehives.  
They are marked P and Q in the scale drawing below.  

Scale: 1 cm represents 50 metres

(a)  If Otis walks at about 2 m/s, estimate how long it takes him to walk  
     from beehive P to beehive Q.  
     [3]

(b)  Bees can indicate to other bees where flowers are.  
     A bee indicates that there are flowers  
       • on a bearing of 055° from P  
       • at a distance of 400 m from P.  
     On the scale drawing, show the point where the flowers are.  
     Label this point F.  
     [2]

(c)  Otis plants some fruit trees, which are  
       • the same distance from P and from Q  
       • 200 m or less from P.  
     Indicate on the scale drawing where Otis plants the trees.  
     You must show all your construction lines.  
     [4]

question-components.a: If Otis walks at about 2 m/s, estimate how long it takes him to walk from beehive P to beehive Q.
question-components.b: Bees can indicate to other bees where flowers are. A bee indicates that there are flowers on a bearing of 055° from P at a distance of 400 m from P. On the scale drawing, show the point where the flowers are. Label this point F.
question-components.c: Otis plants some fruit trees, which are the same distance from P and from Q, and are 200 m or less from P. Indicate on the scale drawing where Otis plants the trees. You must show all your construction lines.

17.question:
17  Six equations are shown below, each labelled with a letter:

A:  y = 6x  
B:  x = ¹/₆y  
C:  y = −3/x  
D:  x = 6/y  
E:  y = 6x  
F:  y = (2/x) + 2  

Choose the correct letters to make each statement true:

(a)  Equation B and equation …………… are equivalent.  [1]

(b)  Equation …………… and equation …………… each show x is inversely proportional to y.  [2]

question-components.a: Equation B and equation …………… are equivalent.
question-components.b: Equation …………… and equation …………… each show x is inversely proportional to y.

18.question:
18  Jo went for a bike ride one evening.  
She travelled x kilometres in 5 hours.

Show that her average speed can be written as  
x/18 m/s.  

[4]
18.question-components: Show that her average speed can be written as x/18 m/s.

19.question:
19. Peter makes a large amount of pink paint by mixing red and white paint in the ratio 2 : 3.

• Red paint costs £80 per 10 litres.  
• White paint costs £5 per 10 litres.  

Peter sells his pink paint in 10-litre tins for £60 per tin.

Calculate how much profit he makes for each tin he sells.  
You must show your working.

£ ……………………………………… [5]
19.question-components: Calculate how much profit he makes for each tin he sells. You must show your working.

21.question:
21 Louise travels to work and home again by train.  
The probability that her train to work is late is 0.7.  
The probability that her train home is late is 0.4.  

What is the probability that at least one of her trains is late?

…………………………………… [4]
21.question-components: What is the probability that at least one of her trains is late?
